result.execSummary:
The defendant William J Alloway was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Huber and good time allowed. Eligible for community service.
Concurrent with: Count 1 in Case number 16CM95.

Credit for 12 days only if revoked.
Concurrent with: 16CM95

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant is eligible for expunction under 973.015 if probation conditions are fully complied with.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must take all medications as prescribed by treating physician/medical provider.

The defendant must enroll and successfully complete an anger management program.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
As deemed appropriate by P&P.
Concurrent with: 16CM95

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J Alloway

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: for funeral furlough - must be granted by DOC as defendant on probation hold - if no hold court grants
30 days jail as conditon of probation

Defendant William J Alloway in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant William J Alloway in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:30 AM. Called 16CM995 and 16CM108. State - here for a motion filed by defendant - puts on the record that he believes the defendant received some bad advice (not from counsel) and wants to withdraw the original plea and now be placed on probation and State has no objections to that. Lynch agrees - asks court to grant motion and modify JOC to reflect 12 months probation. Court asks for legal basis for the motion. Lynch appeals to the court, and for the fact that there are no objections. State makes additional comments in regards to the defendant's issues with jail sentence, states the original recommendation was 1 year probation. Alloway makes statement. Court allows the grandmother to make a statement. Lynch makes another argument for probation. Court makes decision - court will modify the sentence - impose 180 days in FC jail on each count plead to (two cases), consecutive to each other, stayed, place on probation for 1 year on each count plead to - concurrent to each other, with conditions of: anger management and follow thru, take all medications as prescribed, AODA and follow thru, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 200 hours of community service, costs on each count - paid thru probation, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, credit for any time served so far if revoked. Lynch asks for expunction for stated reasons. State has no objections. Court will allow expunction under 973.015, right to appeal, defendant can be released from custody today, adjourned.
Motion to withdraw plea, vacate conviction and resentence

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant William J Alloway in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:29 PM. Called 16CM95 and 16 CM106. State believes there is an agreement. Lynch agrees and recites the agreement. 16CM95 Alloway would plead to count 1 as alleged and count 2 would be DRI. Count 1 - 120 days in FC jail. 16CM106 - Alloway would plead to count 1 as alleged with 10 days FC jail, concurrent to 16CM95. On 16CM95 court DRI count 2, Alloway pleads G to count 1. 16CM106 - defendant pleads G to count 1. Court goes over PLQ with defendant and finds Alloway is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering his plea, waiving his constitutional rights and right to JT, finds factual basis and adjudges guilty. State makes final argument. Lynch makes final argument and asks for time to report, 10/21/16. Alloway with holds comment. Court sentences Alloway to the following: 16CM95 - Count 1 - 120 days in the FC jail, huber and good time allowed, eligible for community service. Costs, 90 DTP after release from jail. 16CM106 - Count 1 - 10 days in FC jail, huber and good time allowed, eligible for community service, jail sentence to run concurrent to 16CM95. Costs, 90 DTP after release from jail. Court will allow Alloway to report on 10/21/2016 at 4:00 PM. 6 days jail credit. Court authorizes expungement under 973.015, once all conditions are met on his sentence and fines are paid in full on or before due date. Required to provide DNA sample (with expungement verbage).  Appeal rights given. Apply any bond posted to cases.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on October 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:30 PM. Called 16CM95 and 16CM106. Lynch informs the Court why his client is not in Court today - explains it to Court, asks Court to not issue a warrant and he has been in steady contact with his attorney, case is almost resolved. State - responds. Court sets both matters for JT, wants verification of the whereabouts of the defendant and then can possibly put it back on the calendar as a FPT, continues bond.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on August 3, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant William J Alloway in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:33 AM. Alloway given complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Alloway understands charges and penalties, may want an attorney. Court continues bond, set for AIA, gives warning of returning without an attorney and instructed to contact SPD and also given court appointed attorney paperwork.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 09:30 am. Recalled at 10:01 AM. Called 16CM106 & 16CM95. Lynch waives reading of both of the complaints, enters NG pleas to all counts, asks for the condition of the bond to be modified as they have a child in common. Court - bond - 16CM95 - no contact with the victim except for child custody issues. Court sets both matters for FPT on 8/3/16 at 3:45 PM.
